verses.roman:
'dāru'-jala'-rūpe kṛṣṇa prakaṭa samprati
'daraśana'-'snāne' kare jīvera mukati

synonyms: dāru—wood; jala—water; rūpe—in the forms of; kṛṣṇa—Lord Kṛṣṇa; prakaṭa—manifested; samprati—at the present moment; daraśana—by seeing; snāne—by bathing; kare—does; jīvera mukati—the deliverance of the conditioned souls.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu said, "In this Age of Kali, Kṛṣṇa is manifest in two forms-wood and water. Thus He helps conditioned souls to become liberated by seeing the wood and bathing in the water.
